metadata.name: New Root Certificate Installed Via CertMgr.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects execution of "certmgr" with the "add" flag in order to install a new certificate on the system. Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\certmgr.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('certmgt.exe') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/add')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('root')))

output.summary: Detects execution of "certmgr" with the "add" flag in order to install a new certificate on the system. Adversaries may install a root certificate on a compromised system to avoid warnings when connecting to adversary controlled web servers.

metadata.objective: False positive: Help Desk or IT may need to manually add a corporate Root CA on occasion.
